abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Third Education
            Project for Paraguay was to increase primary and secondary
            educational opportunities and to adapt them to the needs of
            an expanding economy. The project was satisfactorily
            implemented with an overrun of only 5.2 percent of the
            original cost. The project was completed within the
            estimated time with savings. To utilize these savings the
            Bank and the Borrower agreed to construct 11 primary schools
            in the Asuncion area and to extend the original closing date
            about one year. Success of project implementation may be
            attributed primarily to the fact that a Project
            Implementation Unit (PIU) staffed with a stable cadre of
            full-time qualified professionals, who had been given ample
            autonomy by the Minister of Education, had been carrying out
            its duties since implementation of the First Education
            Project in 1973 and was thoroughly familiar with Bank
            guidelines and procedures.
